t: Psalm 139
The All-Knowing, Ever-Present God
For the choir director. A psalm of David.
Lord,*spn you have searched me and known me.
You*ln know when I sit down and when I stand up; you*ln understand my thoughts from far away.
You*ln observe my travels and my rest; you*ln are aware of all my ways.
Before*ln a word is on my tongue, you*ln know all about it, Lord.*s
You*ln have encircled me; you*ln have placed your hand on me.
This*ln wondrous knowledge is beyond me. It*ln is lofty; I am unable to reach it.
Where*pn can I go to escape your Spirit? Where*ln can I flee from your presence?
If*ln I go up to heaven, you are there; if*ln I make my bed in Sheol, you are there.
If*ln I fly on the wings of the dawn and*ln settle down on the western horizon,
even*ln there your hand will lead me; your*ln right hand will hold on to me.
If*ln I say, “Surely the darkness will hide me, and*ln the light around me will be night”—
even*ln the darkness is not dark to you. The*ln night shines like the day; darkness*ln and light are alike to you.
For*pn it was you who created my inward parts; you*ln knit me together in my mother’s womb.
I*ln will praise you because*ln I have been remarkably and wondrously made. Your*ln works are wondrous, and*ln I know this very well.
My*ln bones were not hidden from you when*ln I was made in secret, when*ln I was formed in the depths of the earth.
Your*ln eyes saw me when I was formless; all*ln my days were written in your book and planned before*ln a single one of them began.
God,*pn how precious your thoughts are to me; how*ln vast their sum is!
If*ln I counted them, they*ln would outnumber the grains of sand; when*ln I wake up, I am still with you.
God,*pn if only you would kill the wicked — you*ln bloodthirsty men, stay away from me—
who*ln invoke you deceitfully. Your*ln enemies swear by you falsely.
Lord,*sln don’t I hate those who hate you, and*ln detest those who rebel against you?
I*ln hate them with extreme hatred; I*ln consider them my enemies.
Search*pn me, God, and know my heart; test*ln me and know my concerns.
See*ln if there is any offensive way in me; lead*ln me in the everlasting way.
